title: Search warrant at Love Ranch reveals statements about Lamar Odom's "mystery pills"
text: Share Updated: 1:45 pm LAS VEGAS (KSNV News3LV) -- Search warrants obtained by News 3 reveal more about what may have happened to Lamar Odom in the hours and days before he was found unconscious at Love Ranch brothel in Crystal, Nevada. The detective who signed the affidavit for the warrant explained exactly who he spoke with at Love Ranch brothel and later at Desert View Hospital. "During the course of the investigation, we interviewed the manager of the Love Ranch as well as two prostitutes, which were engaged with Mr. Odom prior to the reported incident," the report reads. In the report, the detective indicates that the women Odom was with said he was using pills."During his initial time at the Love Ranch, he was observed both by eyewitnesses as well as on video surveillance camera to be ingesting an unknown substance in the form of an unidentified pill, which he obtained from his pocket in a plastic bag that was unmarked."In addition to the pills, the women the detective interviewed said that Odom was also using cocaine."They indicated that they heard him snorting. They indicated that they has vague knowledge of him using illicit narcotics."The detective was also issued a warrant to obtain a blood sample from Odom to test for narcotics and to prove that Odom had possibly overdosed. In an interview also documented in the paperwork, the detective spoke with Odom's personal assistant, who admitted that he knew that Odom was using narcotics and that he had done so in the past.According to the Associated Press, Odom's family says his speech is improving as he undergoes therapy in Los Angeles. A statement released Thursday by Alvina Alston, publicist for Odom's aunt JaNean Mercer, says Odom "is beginning to gradually flourish both mentally and physically."
